bug.short_desc: "dnf -q -d 0 install XYZ" is not quiet, it prints "Package XYZ... is already installed, skipping."

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: dnf with -q option should output nothing. But when trying to install an already installed package, dnf prints an error message that the package is already installed.
Option "-q" does not supress the message, option "-d 0" does not supress the message, too.
Option "-e 1" or "-e 0" supresses the message, but option "-e" is marked as depredicated in the manpage:
-e <error level>, --errorlevel=<error level> Error output level. This is an integer value between 0 (no error output) and 10 (shows all error messages), default is 2. Deprecated, use -v instead.
I haven't found an option other than "-e" to suppress this (warning) message (it is not really an error, because the package is installed as it was intended).
I think that either there should be a replacement for "-e" that works as expected, e.g. -q should print no messages, or "-e" should not marked as depredicated.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): dnf-1.1.1-2.fc22.noarch
How reproducible: Always.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. LANG=C dnf -q -d 0 install bash 2. LANG=C dnf -q -d 0 -e 1 install bash
Actual results: 1. Output: "Package bash-4.3.42-1.fc22.x86_64 is already installed, skipping." 2. No output.
Expected results: 1. No output of the command. 2. No output of the command. Option "-e" is marked as depredicated and should not be neccessary.

The same message appears for already installed groups:
LANG=C dnf -q -d 0 install @development-libs Group 'Development Libraries' is already installed, skipping.
We will check -q behaviour of other system tools and provide a compatible solution.
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.
If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug.
Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.

This problem still exist in Fedora 24.
dnf-1.1.9-2.fc24.noarch
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.

The problem was fixed in dnf-2.0
[test@dhcp-0-213 dnf]$ rpm -q dnf dnf-2.0.0_0.rc1.1-70gd03a46f.fc25.noarch [test@dhcp-0-213 dnf]$ sudo dnf install libreoffice-calc Last metadata expiration check: 0:19:03 ago on Fri Dec 02 16:11:56 2016 CET.
